item.title: :car: Robert :world_map:
item.description: My car - Robert - likes travelling and we both like maps 🌍. So a further personal project will be to explore spatial data in R…

item.title: Getting PubMed Metadata from within RStudio with RISmed
item.description: What is this post about? Introduction - what were the problems I faced? RISmed package How to use RISmed? What is this post about? For my master’s thesis (blogpost following - stay tuned 😎) I came at a point where I was interested in having a closer look at publication meta data (e.g. publications per year) PubMed usually does provide this service when you execute your search, for some reason it failed for my query

item.title: Useful hints for Endnote
item.description: 💡 A collection of hints for working with Endnote this is a working document primarily addressed at students from the Institute of Nursing Science at University of Basel and may change over time - feedback welcome What is this document and why? Endnote is the citation manager proclaimed in many courses at the INS. Over the past years I’ve encountered a number of struggles personally or through my peers. This document lists the major problems I’ve seen and offers solutions that worked for me.

item.title: shurp2018 - :package:
item.description: What is it about? Some of my recent work includes writing the shurp2018-package. This R package contains all the functions used to produce descriptive reports for a study called SHURP2018 - a research project at the Institute of Nursing Science, more information is found here: https://shurp.unibas.ch more information will follow

item.title: About me
item.description: My name is Catherine Blatter and I am trained as a registered general nurse (RN) located in Switzerland. I’m currently finishing my Master’s degree and working as a research assistant at the Institute of Nursing Science (INS) at the University of Basel. 💻 📈 My research interest lies in quality of care in health services research. More precisely how data can be used to improve quality of care and account for the physical and emotional health of health care workers.
